title: (x) galt house - Bell Gothic Black, Bickham Script {Nick, Seb}
content:
I need help finding the typeface in the brochure. I know the bottom faces are Adobe Garamond. The script looks like Bickham, but it is not. The "best of louisville" I have seen in Qudoba ads, but I am not sure what it is. The "stay in the heart of it" looks Trade gothic.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202011328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/galt_6611.jpg)
author: signs79

comments.content:
Louisville is Bell Gothic Black

Nick Cooke
Bell Gothic Black = BEST OF LOUISVILLE.

Ha! eat my dust sucker! :^)

Nick Cooke
Script is definitely Bickham Script Pro with the 'th' ligature

"STAY IN THE HEART OF IT" is close to the 300mg width of [Pill Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202011328/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/betatype/pill-gothic/), if you want that one too.

[Nick & Seb, don't you believe in adding links? Or is that just for speed?]

- Mike Yanega

I withdraw Pill Gothic. The counters are too squared.

- Mike Yanega
I think I was right about Trade Gothic being the secondary type.

Ooops! My bad. I didn't read all the way to the end. Trade Gothic Condensed does look right.

- Mike Yanega
The "p" and "th" appear to be custom-- there are no ligatures that match them.

Yeah Mike, just for speed. I'm stacked out at the mo.

Nick Cooke

Below Bickham Script sheared 10 degrees:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202011328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bickham_5880.png)

To Mike, excuse my previous laziness...

Seb and Nick, I guess I came across as nagging, when I meant it to be a nudge. I'm sorry for that. I should have added the winking emoticon, if I said anything at all.

- Mike Yanega

You are not nagging Mike. Keep those boys straight :-)  
Michael

I wasn't offended â€“ I'm demob happy, off to South Africa tomorrow. Hooray! No more work for 3 weeks, no more Typophile either, I'm not one of those idiots who sit kerning by the pool or checking emails on my laptop.

Merry Christmas everybody!

Nick Cooke
Nick, I hope you're not flying British Airways, or you may not get back!

Safe trip Nick... but at least take a pen or three :-)

Michael
And a camera of course, that goes without saying really :-P
